remarks: A member of a function's range is a value of the function, analogous to ~ fvelrnb with the additional requirement that the member must be a set.  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 25-May-2017.)
statement:
afvelrnb $p |- ( ( F Fn A /\ B e. V ) -> ( B e. ran F <-> E. x e. A ( F ''' x ) = B ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d F x $.
